text.p: These are the leading stories in Zambia's newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The U.N. High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR) and the German government gave Zambia $590,000 to cater for refugees fleeing war-torn Zaire.
- Opposition parties say they will boycott the local government elections and all future by-elections.
- President Frederick Chiluba is to open an investment opportunities conference organised by Financial Times conference and the Zambia privatisation Agency on Wednesday.
- Opposition supporters clash with ruling party cadres after hearing ongoing proceedings in an electoral petition challenging the credentials of state president Frederick Chiluba.
- The Drug Enforcement Commission says its offices in the city centre were broken into last Saturday.
- Journalists named a self-regulatory media council headed by justice Florence Mumba.
